\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/admin/index:module-pine.backend.admin}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/admin/index:pine-backend-admin}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/admin/index::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!pine.backend.admin@\spxentry{pine.backend.admin}}\index{pine.backend.admin@\spxentry{pine.backend.admin}!module@\spxentry{module}}

an external Auth service

Save new NER annotations and labels to the database as an entry for the logged in user, for the document. If there
are already annotations, use a patch request to update with the new annotations. If there are not, use a post

\subparagraph{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.collections}}}
\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/collections/index:module-pine.backend.collections}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/collections/index:pine-backend-collections}}\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/collections/index::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!pine.backend.collections@\spxentry{pine.backend.collections}}\index{pine.backend.collections@\spxentry{pine.backend.collections}!module@\spxentry{module}}

This module contains the api methods required to interact with, organize, create, and display collections in the
front\sphinxhyphen{}end and store the collections in the backend

\index{get\_user\_collections() (in module pine.backend.collections.bp)@\spxentry{get\_user\_collections()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.collections.bp}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/collections/bp/index:pine.backend.collections.bp.get_user_collections}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.collections.bp.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_user\_collections}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{archived}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{page}}}{}
Return collections for the logged in user using pagination. Returns all collections if parameter “page” is “all”,
or the collections associated with the given page. Can return archived or un\sphinxhyphen{}archived collections based upon the
“archived” flag.
:param archived: Bool
:param page: str
:return: Response

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_unarchived\_user\_collections() (in module pine.backend.collections.bp)@\spxentry{get\_unarchived\_user\_collections()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.collections.bp}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/collections/bp/index:pine.backend.collections.bp.get_unarchived_user_collections}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.collections.bp.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_unarchived\_user\_collections}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{page}}}{}
Return unarchived user collections for the corresponding page value. Default value returns collections for all
pages.
:param page: str
:return: Response

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_collection() (in module pine.backend.collections.bp)@\spxentry{create\_collection()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.collections.bp}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/collections/bp/index:pine.backend.collections.bp.create_collection}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.collections.bp.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_collection}}}{}{}
Create a new collection based upon the entries provided in the POST request’s associated form fields.
These fields include:
collection \sphinxhyphen{} collection name
overlap \sphinxhyphen{} ratio of overlapping documents. (0\sphinxhyphen{}1) with 0 being no overlap and 1 being every document has overlap, ex:
\begin{quote}

.90 \sphinxhyphen{} 90\% of documents overlap
\end{quote}

train\_every \sphinxhyphen{} automatically train a new classifier after this many documents have been annotated
pipelineId \sphinxhyphen{} the id value of the classifier pipeline associated with this collection (spacy, opennlp, corenlp)
classifierParameters \sphinxhyphen{} optional parameters that adjust the configuration of the chosen classifier pipeline.
archived \sphinxhyphen{} whether or not this collection should be archived.
A collection can be created with documents listed in a csv file. Each new line in the csv represents a new document.
The data of this csv can be passed to this method through the POST request’s FILES field “file”.
used when creating a collection based on an uploaded csv file:
\begin{quote}

csvTextCol \sphinxhyphen{} column of csv containing the text of the documents (default: 0)
csvHasHeader \sphinxhyphen{} boolean for whether or not the csv file has a header row (default: False)
\end{quote}

A collection can also be created with a number of images through FILES fields “imageFileN” where N is an (ignored) index
:return: information about the created collection

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{\_check\_collection\_and\_get\_image\_dir() (in module pine.backend.collections.bp)@\spxentry{\_check\_collection\_and\_get\_image\_dir()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.collections.bp}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/collections/bp/index:pine.backend.collections.bp._check_collection_and_get_image_dir}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.collections.bp.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_check\_collection\_and\_get\_image\_dir}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{collection\_id}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{path}}}{}

\index{\_channel\_watchdog() (pine.backend.job\_manager.service.ServiceManager method)@\spxentry{\_channel\_watchdog()}\spxextra{pine.backend.job\_manager.service.ServiceManager method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/job_manager/service/index:pine.backend.job_manager.service.ServiceManager._channel_watchdog}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{async }}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_channel\_watchdog}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{self}}}{}
Channel Watchdog Implementation.
In asyncio, it monitors the channel\sphinxhyphen{}ttl keys and the channels SET to expire registered services as needed.
The other functionality is to register new channels as they’re added to the pubsub in the processing listener.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{compute\_total\_f1\_matrix() (pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.agree.F1Agreement method)@\spxentry{compute\_total\_f1\_matrix()}\spxextra{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.agree.F1Agreement method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/pineiaa/bratiaa/agree/index:pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.agree.F1Agreement.compute_total_f1_matrix}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_total\_f1\_matrix}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{self}}}{}
Returns (n x n) matrix, where n is the number of annotators, containing
pair\sphinxhyphen{}wise total F1 scores between all annotators.

By definition, the matrix is symmetric and F1 = 1 on the main diagonal.

\end{fulllineitems}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{exact\_match\_token\_evaluation() (in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation)@\spxentry{exact\_match\_token\_evaluation()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/pineiaa/bratiaa/evaluation/index:pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation.exact_match_token_evaluation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exact\_match\_token\_evaluation}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{ann\_list\_1}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{ann\_list\_2}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{tokens}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
Annotations are split into token\sphinxhyphen{}sized bits before true positives, false positives and false negatives are computed.

Sub\sphinxhyphen{}token annotations are expanded to full tokens. Long annotations will influence the results more than short
annotations. Boundary errors for adjacent annotations with the same label are ignored!

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{counter2list() (in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation)@\spxentry{counter2list()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/pineiaa/bratiaa/evaluation/index:pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation.counter2list}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{counter2list}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{c}}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{\_read\_token\_annotations() (in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation)@\spxentry{\_read\_token\_annotations()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/pineiaa/bratiaa/evaluation/index:pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation._read_token_annotations}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.evaluation.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_read\_token\_annotations}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{ann\_list}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{tokens}}}{}
Yields a new annotation for each token overlapping with an annotation. If annotations are overlapping each other,
there will be multiple annotations for a single token.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{compute\_total\_f1\_matrix() (pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.F1Agreement method)@\spxentry{compute\_total\_f1\_matrix()}\spxextra{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.F1Agreement method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/pineiaa/bratiaa/index:pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.F1Agreement.compute_total_f1_matrix}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{compute\_total\_f1\_matrix}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{self}}}{}
Returns (n x n) matrix, where n is the number of annotators, containing
pair\sphinxhyphen{}wise total F1 scores between all annotators.

By definition, the matrix is symmetric and F1 = 1 on the main diagonal.

\end{fulllineitems}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{exact\_match\_token\_evaluation() (in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa)@\spxentry{exact\_match\_token\_evaluation()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/pineiaa/bratiaa/index:pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.exact_match_token_evaluation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.pineiaa.bratiaa.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exact\_match\_token\_evaluation}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{ann\_list\_1}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{ann\_list\_2}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{tokens}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
Annotations are split into token\sphinxhyphen{}sized bits before true positives, false positives and false negatives are computed.

Sub\sphinxhyphen{}token annotations are expanded to full tokens. Long annotations will influence the results more than short
annotations. Boundary errors for adjacent annotations with the same label are ignored!

\end{fulllineitems}

\\

\index{transform\_module\_by\_config() (in module pine.backend.shared.transform)@\spxentry{transform\_module\_by\_config()}\spxextra{in module pine.backend.shared.transform}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/backend/shared/transform/index:pine.backend.shared.transform.transform_module_by_config}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.backend.shared.transform.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{transform\_module\_by\_config}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{module\_ref}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{config\_ref}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{config\_prefix}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
Transforms a given module’s properties based on ConfigBuilder Values.
The prefix can be used to avoid blindy changing values and target a subset of matching values in config\_ref.
:type module\_ref: ModuleType
:type config\_ref: dict
:type config\_prefix: str

\end{fulllineitems}

Adds a new document to a collection and returns its ID.

Will use the logged in user ID for the creator\_id if none is given.  Although all the
parameters are optional, you must provide values either in the document or through the
kwargs in order to make a valid document.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {}

\item {}

\item {}

\item {}

\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ner\_annotations}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#list}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}}) \textendash{} NER annotations, where each annotation is either a list or a dict

\end{itemize}

\item {}

\item {}

\end{itemize}

\index{setup\_logging() (in module pine.client.log)@\spxentry{setup\_logging()}\spxextra{in module pine.client.log}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/log/index:pine.client.log.setup_logging}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.client.log.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{setup\_logging}}}{}{}
Sets up logging, if configured to do so.

The environment variable named by {\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/log/index:pine.client.log.CONFIG_FILE_ENV}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CONFIG\_FILE\_ENV}}}}} is checked and, if present, is
passed to \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.config.html\#logging.config.dictConfig}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{logging.config.dictConfig()}}}.

\end{fulllineitems}

Checks whether the given user object is valid.

A valid user object has an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\_id}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{firstname}}, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lastname}} that are non\sphinxhyphen{}empty string
fields.  If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{email}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{description}}, or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{passwdhash}} are present, they are string fields.
If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{role}} is present, it is a list of strings that are either \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{administrator}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{user}}.

that is a non\sphinxhyphen{}empty list of strings.  If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{annotators}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{viewers}} are provided, they are
lists of strings.  If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{metadata}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{configuration}} are provided, they are dicts.  If

\index{is\_valid\_collection() (in module pine.client.models)@\spxentry{is\_valid\_collection()}\spxextra{in module pine.client.models}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/models/index:pine.client.models.is_valid_collection}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.client.models.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{is\_valid\_collection}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{form}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{files}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{error\_callback}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{typing.Callable{[}{[}str{]}, None{]}} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{bool}}}
Checks whether the given form and files parameters are valid for creating a collection.

A valid form has a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{collection}} that is a dict field and is valid via
{\hyperref[\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/models/index:pine.client.models.is_valid_eve_collection}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{is\_valid\_eve\_collection()}}}}}.  Additionally, the collection has string \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{title}} and
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{description}} fields in its \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{metadata}}.  It also has at least one element for \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{labels}},
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{viewers}}, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{annotators}}, and the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{creator\_id}} must be in both \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{viewers}} and
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{annotators}}.

The form also has \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{overlap}} as a float field between 0 and 1 (inclusive), \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{train\_every}} as
an int field that is at least 5, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pipelineId}} as a string field.

If files are provided, file \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file}} and any files starting with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{imageFile}} are checked.
If a file \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{file}} is provided, the form must also have a boolean \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{csvHasHeader}} field and an
int \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{csvTextCol}} field.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{form}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}}) \textendash{} form data to send to backend

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{files}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}}) \textendash{} file data to send to backend

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{error\_callback}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{function}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} optional callback that is called with any error messages, defaults to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}}

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
whether the given form and files parameters are valid for creating a collection

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{bool}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{is\_valid\_eve\_document() (in module pine.client.models)@\spxentry{is\_valid\_eve\_document()}\spxextra{in module pine.client.models}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/models/index:pine.client.models.is_valid_eve_document}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.client.models.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{is\_valid\_eve\_document}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{document}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{error\_callback}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{typing.Callable{[}{[}str{]}, None{]}} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{bool}}}
Checks whether the given document object is valid.

A valid document has a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{creator\_id}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{collection\_id}} that are non\sphinxhyphen{}empty string fields.
Optionally, it may have an int \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{overlap}} field, string \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{text\textasciigrave{}\textasciigrave{}field, and dict
\textasciigrave{}\textasciigrave{}metadata}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{has\_annotated}} fields.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

Checks whether the given annotation is a valid document NER annotation.

Valid NER annotations take one of two forms: a \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}}} or a
\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#list}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}}}/\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#tuple}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}} of size 3.

A valid NER \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dict}}} has the following fields:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{start}}: an \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}} that is \textgreater{}= 0

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{end}}: an \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}} that is \textgreater{}= 0

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{label}}: a non\sphinxhyphen{}empty \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}}

\end{itemize}

A valid NER \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#list}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{list}}}/\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#tuple}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}} has the following elements:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
element \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}}: an \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}} that is \textgreater{}= 0

\item {} 
element \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{1}}: an \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}} that is \textgreater{}= 0

\item {} 
element \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{2}}: a non\sphinxhyphen{}empty \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}}

\end{itemize}

\index{remove\_nonupdatable\_fields() (in module pine.client.models)@\spxentry{remove\_nonupdatable\_fields()}\spxextra{in module pine.client.models}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/models/index:pine.client.models.remove_nonupdatable_fields}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.client.models.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{remove\_nonupdatable\_fields}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{obj}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}}}}{}
Removes all non\sphinxhyphen{}updatable fields from the given object.

These fields would cause a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PUT}}/\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{PATCH}} to be rejected because they are not user\sphinxhyphen{}modifiable.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{obj}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}}) \textendash{} the object

\end{description}\end{quote}

Adds a new document to a collection and returns its ID.

Will use the logged in user ID for the creator\_id if none is given.  Although all the
parameters are optional, you must provide values either in the document or through the
kwargs in order to make a valid document.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {}

\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{collection\_id}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} optional collection\_id for the document, defaults to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{None}} (not set)

\item {}

\item {}

\item {}

\index{setup\_logging() (in module pine.client)@\spxentry{setup\_logging()}\spxextra{in module pine.client}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/client/index:pine.client.setup_logging}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.client.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{setup\_logging}}}{}{}
Sets up logging, if configured to do so.

The environment variable named by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{CONFIG\_FILE\_ENV}} is checked and, if present, is
passed to \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.config.html\#logging.config.dictConfig}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{logging.config.dictConfig()}}}.

\end{fulllineitems}

&
Transforms a given module’s properties based on ConfigBuilder Values.
\\
\hline
\end{longtable}\sphinxatlongtableend\end{savenotes}
\index{transform\_module\_by\_config() (in module pine.pipelines.shared.transform)@\spxentry{transform\_module\_by\_config()}\spxextra{in module pine.pipelines.shared.transform}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/pipelines/shared/transform/index:pine.pipelines.shared.transform.transform_module_by_config}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.pipelines.shared.transform.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{transform\_module\_by\_config}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{module\_ref}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{config\_ref}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{config\_prefix}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
Transforms a given module’s properties based on ConfigBuilder Values.
The prefix can be used to avoid blindy changing values and target a subset of matching values in config\_ref.
:type module\_ref: ModuleType
:type config\_ref: dict
:type config\_prefix: str

\end{fulllineitems}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{autoapi/pine/pipelines/RankingFunctions/index:pine.pipelines.RankingFunctions.rank}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pine.pipelines.RankingFunctions.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{rank}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{results}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{metric}}}{}
if metric == ‘lc’: return least\_confidence(results)
if metric == ‘ma’: return largest\_margin(results)
if metric == ‘en’: return entropy\_rank(results)
if metric == ‘lcs’: return least\_confidence\_squared(results)
if metric == ‘lce’: return least\_confidence\_squared\_by\_entity(results)
if metric == ‘ra’: return random\_rank(results)
if metric == ‘mlp’: return most\_of\_least\_popular(results)
return \sphinxhyphen{}1

\#Dictionary method is inefficient as it runs every method before returning one

\end{fulllineitems}
